discourse_list.title: Proposal for the Creation of a MakerDao Nft Marketplace

content.content: The Nft marketplace is an ocean that is starting to turn reddish, but there is still much room for development and evolution.  cc9ead82-3466-4a9a-941f-a5a11ebea3e31080×337 14.8 KB  What I propose is the creation of an NFT marketplace in which 2% of the commissions from the sales of the Nft will be distributed as follows:   1% for the Maker treasury   0.6% to the buyers (each in proportion to their purchases)   0.2% to increase the multi-collateral backing of Maker Collection   0.2% for maintenance and reinvestment in the development of the marketplace.   That would be the first collection of the marketplace and would have a growing multi-collateral backing. Half of the royalties will go to the Maker treasury or to fund Maker expansion into RWA and RWF , and the other half will increase the multi-collateral backing of the same collection.  77b2ce46-68b8-403c-a0da-dd1b26f3935c1025×540 21.2 KB  Multi collateral backing in the Collection Each NFT will have a certain amount of WBTC, ETH, LINK, COMP, FTM, MANA, AAVE, YFI, etc., backing it and safeguarding it in a smart contract, that would make the Nft have a more constant and stable floor value than the art ones, it would benefit both Maker and the Nft owner, Maker would be able to bring capital to its treasury and the owner due to the backing of its Nft. If the Nft owner wants the multi-collateral backing, he can use his Nft as a key to access the support that corresponds to his unit. Still, the Nft will be temporarily blocked in the contract until the multi collateral corresponding to the Nft is placed. This proposal could complement this other  one to make the Maker extension for the Nft more complete. Please leave your opinion or proposals.
The essence of Maker is Maker. The essence of opensea is opensea.
And the essence of Amazon was selling books online.
Maker should try to cover other markets in the future, it is good to diversify, but even better is to polish the initial product and service before going to other markets
It makes sense in a way, especially since NFTs could possibly be included as colateral, Nfts can also map RWA, NFTs do not necessarily have to be digital art or entertainment.
I’m sorry, but I’m not joining this boat I like nfts and everything they imply, but I don’t see a maker marketplace as relevant, there is already opensea, rarible, etc. Nothing new.
For the time being, no marketplace provides incentives to buy Nfts

I agree, although the cost to create this project is very low in relation to the profit potential it can leave to the Dao, the risk is also low since the base infrastructure is done and working, only slight modifications would be implemented, it can be done without great effort and resources

I can do a thorough analysis on the specific implementation and bring it, in case the community and the team likes the proposal. Almost everything would be programming with the help of remix.ethereum.org, spending on fee to upload the smart contracts to a layer 2 so that anyone can use the marketplace, develop the website and pay for its hosting.
While it’s an interesting proposal, I afraid that it is outside the scope of Maker protocol for now. It seems to make more sense to collaborate with existing NFT marketplaces instead of our own.

It seems to me a more than interesting proposal, maybe a bit poorly explained, poorly defined, but certainly very competitive. I think the same as many others here, although it is not the maker’s job, it would be an interesting business for maker. The best we can do for now I think is to ally with a makertplace that is starting and offer them help and thus earn part of those commissions.

I am confused.  Wouldn’t this have a very high cost component?   i.e. to access the underlying collateral would require a lot of gas. Or would these never be broken apart? I really am failing to see the value to Maker here.  Now if this was backed by UNISWAP v2 wBTC-DAI, ETH-DAI, LINK-DAI, COMP-DAI, FTM-DAI, MANA-DAI, AAVE-DAI, YFI-DAI maybe it would be more interesting because it would be a NFT that is like a market composit that actually earns return and locks tokens paired with DAI… As this sits I don’t think it would be very useful and just locks away collateral for no real return.  I also don’t think it would trade that much (or the expense to trade it is going to be far higher than the base value of the token). idk.

Thanks for your input, I had just thought about the backend being in turn earning interest, but I thought I would start with something simpler and more practical to do, it is good idea to implement it in a v2 of the collection or directly in v1 depending, I mentioned that it would be mounted on a layer 2,  spending on fee to upload the smart contracts to a layer 2  This proposal is in turn to give it a more stable and predictable floor value, to then build more ultilities on it, another possible solution to the problem presented here Product Discussion: NFTs as MakerDAO Collateral and here [PUNK] Collateral Onboarding Application, for future implementation of other collections in the Maker vault that use the same or similar model. Everything in this proposal is modifiable.
It could be the best way to enter this market by doing something similar to the Nike/RTFKT case.

Auction-backed Dai Maker Improvement Proposals   Context Some ages ago, I heard @cmooney and @brianmcmichael (I might be forgetting someone else) mentioned a mechanism to provide backed Dai through an auction system.  As I tried to work out how this would work, I produced this document. All mistakes are mine, and the credit is theirs.  I’m posting this now because @monet-supply and @0xToes are steering the conversation towards NFTs again, so it might be helpful.   *** THERE ARE MORE QUESTIONS THAN ANSWERS, highlighted with a * on each step **…

Very interesting your contributions about NFTs. I agree that perhaps the incidence of using them as collateral can vary widely within the MakerDAO community. The theory of multi-collateral backing in the Collection is probably interesting as a core proposal. Perhaps some kind of consensus can be established around other related areas. For example: the utility of NFTs to access special governance votes, which would make their price not speculative, rather it would create a valuable asset for those who want to make important decisions. Just thinking about the opportunities can lead to great things, perhaps it should be impacted with a slightly more massive proposal. Greetings!
